name: brainstorm
trans: n. 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动 vt. 集体讨论；集思广益以寻找 vi. 集体讨论；动脑筋；出主意

sentences.english: While some of the greatest ideas and solutions come up in brainstorm meetings, we also lose most of our time in discussion without action.
sentences.chinese: 当在头脑风暴的会议上有一些顶级的主意或者解决方法提出时，我们也浪费了很多时间在没有行动的讨论上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动
集体讨论；集思广益以寻找

name: celebrate
trans: vt. 庆祝；举行；赞美；祝贺；宣告 vi. 庆祝；过节；举行宗教仪式

sentences.english: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.english: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.english: poems that celebrate the joys of love
sentences.chinese: 赞美爱之喜悦的诗歌

detailed_translations.english: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable

name: conceive
trans: vt. 怀孕；构思；以为；持有 vi. 怀孕；设想；考虑

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: creative
trans: adj. 创造性的

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

name: grid
trans: n. 网格；格子，栅格；输电网

sentences.english: the national grid
sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

name: project
trans: n. （生产或研究）工程；方案；计划；事业；项目；专题研究；住房，廉租住宅区 v. 设计；计划；抛射；投射；表现；促进（观点或意象）；确立（好印象）；突出；预测；发送；（声音）扩及远处；想象（自己或场景）在另一个时间或地点；作……投影线；（情感、愿望）无意投射转移（给别人）

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: bark
trans: n. 树皮；深青棕色；毛皮；皮肤；狗叫 vt. 狗叫；尖叫；剥皮 n. (Bark)人名；(英、西、德、捷、法、芬、瑞典)巴克；(阿拉伯、俄)巴尔克

sentences.english: In Finland purists insist that only birch bark should be added.
sentences.chinese: 在芬兰，纯化论者坚持说只能加白桦树皮。

sentences.english: Cork bark is closely intertwined with the lives of the people in these regions.
sentences.chinese: 软木橡树的树皮与这些地方的百姓生活密切地交织在一起。

sentences.english: In his workshop, a Kakunodate craftsman prepares the cherry bark before applying this as a veneer to a range of objects.
sentences.chinese: 在将这种工艺作为一系列物体的单板运用之前，角馆的工匠在自己的作坊准备樱花树皮。

detailed_translations.english: the outer covering of a tree

name: chlorophyll
trans: n. [植][生化] 叶绿素

sentences.english: The chlorophyll in wheatgrass also helps to purify the liver.
sentences.chinese: 麦草中的叶绿素同样可以帮助净化肝脏。

sentences.english: Wheatgrass has antibiotic properties and is packed with chlorophyll as it is a plant.
sentences.chinese: 麦草含有抗生素，由于它是一种植物，所以含有许多叶绿素。

sentences.english: This could be estimated at 1000 litres of hydrogen for 330 grams of chlorophyll per day whereas for example colza produces roughly only 1000 litres of oil per hectare . . .
sentences.chinese: 这种农场每天估计能够产生1000升氢气，而且只消耗330克叶绿素； 而比如种植菜籽，每公顷土地才能产生大约1000升油。

detailed_translations.english: the green-coloured substance in plants

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物；滋养物 adj. 营养的；滋养的

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: sap
trans: n. （植物的）液，汁；精力，元气；坑道，地道；（非正式）笨蛋，傻瓜；大头短棒，棍棒 v. 使衰竭，使伤元气；挖坑道；挖掘以破坏基础；（水等作用）逐渐侵蚀；用大头短棒击 n. (Sap) （印、乌克兰、美、法、荷）萨（人名）

sentences.english: The leaves, bark and sap are also common ingredients of local herbal remedies.
sentences.chinese: 树叶、树皮和树液也是当地草药疗法的常用药材。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 树液；精力，元气；活力；坑道
detailed_translations.english: the watery substance that carries food through a plant

detailed_translations.chinese: 使衰竭，使伤元气；挖掘以破坏基础

name: sprout
trans: vi. 发芽；长芽 vt. 使发芽；使萌芽 n. 芽；萌芽；苗芽 n. (Sprout)人名；(英)斯普劳特

sentences.english: Move the pots outside when the seeds begin to sprout.
sentences.chinese: 种子开始发芽时把盆搬到外面去。

sentences.english: Trees were starting to sprout new leaves.
sentences.chinese: 树上开始抽出新叶。

detailed_translations.english: if vegetables, seeds, or plants sprout, they start to grow, producing  shoots  ,  buds  , or leaves
a small green vegetable like a very small  cabbage

name: ancient
trans: adj. 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的 n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: Athens
trans: n. 雅典（希腊首都）

sentences.english: Can you tell me something about the Acropolis in Athens?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我讲一些关于雅典卫城的事吗?

sentences.english: If you’re on a cruise through the Mediterranean, you might only have one day in Athens.
sentences.chinese: 假如你在一个穿越地中海的乘船观光团上，你就大概只能在雅典呆一天。

sentences.english: The best thing for me is that I have equaled what I have done at Athens.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，最好的事情是，我取得了在雅典曾经取得过的成绩。

name: column
trans: n. 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: Greek
trans: n. (Greek) 希腊人；希腊语；（有希腊字母名称的）大学生联谊会会员 adj. (Greek) 希腊的；希腊人的，希腊语的 n. (Greek) （美）格雷克（人名）

sentences.english: Greek yoghurt
sentences.chinese: 希腊式酸奶

detailed_translations.english: relating to Greece, its people, or its language
someone from Greece

name: landmark
trans: n. [航]陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事 adj. 有重大意义或影响的 n. （瑞典、挪）兰德马克（人名）

name: struggle
trans: v. 奋斗；艰难地行进；斗争；搏斗；争夺；挣扎成名 n. 斗争；冲突；使劲；奋斗；难事

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

name: compliment
trans: n. 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺 vt. 恭维；称赞

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: flatter
trans: vt. 奉承；谄媚；使高兴

sentences.english: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.chinese: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

name: greedy
trans: adj. 贪婪的；贪吃的；渴望的

sentences.english: a greedy and selfish society
sentences.chinese: 一个贪婪自私的社会

sentences.english: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。

sentences.english: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
sentences.chinese: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的 vt. 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: pasture
trans: n. 草地；牧场；牧草 vt. 放牧；吃草 n. (Pasture)人名；(英)帕斯彻；(法)帕斯蒂尔

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

name: strength
trans: n. 力量；力气；兵力；长处

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: department
trans: n. 部；部门；系；科；局

sentences.english: the personnel department
sentences.chinese: 人事部

sentences.english: the English department
sentences.chinese: 英语系

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

name: emotion
trans: n. 情感；情绪

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: furniture
trans: n. 家具；设备；储藏物

sentences.english: I helped him choose the furniture for his house.
sentences.chinese: 我帮他挑选房子里用的家具。

sentences.english: I can’t think of a single piece of furniture in my house that I bought new.
sentences.chinese: 我想不出家里有哪件家具是新买的。

sentences.english: office furniture
sentences.chinese: 办公室家具

detailed_translations.english: large objects such as chairs, tables, beds, and cupboards

name: swallow
trans: vt. 忍受；吞没 vi. 吞下；咽下 n. 燕子；一次吞咽的量 n. (Swallow)人名；(英)斯沃洛

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: transform
trans: vt. 改变，使…变形；转换 vi. 变换，改变；转化

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: troll
trans: n. （北欧神话中的）穴居巨怪，侏儒；挑衅帖子，发挑衅帖子的人（非正式）；钓鱼；轮唱 v. 拖饵钓鱼；搜查；发布挑衅帖子（非正式）；散步；欢快地高唱；轮唱；随便浏览（报纸或文件）

sentences.english: Ships towing huge magnets trolled the ocean floor.
sentences.chinese: 船只拖着巨大的磁石在海底进行拖捞作业。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用曳绳钓； 拖钓； 兴高采烈地唱
detailed_translations.english: to try to remove something from a river, ocean etc by pulling a rope, line etc through the water

name: continent
trans: n. 大陆，洲，陆地 adj. 自制的，克制的

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

name: extreme
trans: adj. 极端的；极度的；偏激的；尽头的 n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: globe
trans: n. 地球；地球仪；球体 vt. 使…成球形 vi. 成球状

sentences.english: Three large globes stand on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 3个巨大的地球仪立在地板上。

sentences.english: We export our goods all over the globe.
sentences.chinese: 我们的商品出口到世界各地。

detailed_translations.english: the world

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地 n. (Habitat)人名；(德)哈比塔特

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查 vi. 研究；调查 vt. 研究；调查 [ 过去式 researched 过去分词 researched 现在分词 researching ]

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培 vt. [细胞][微] 培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: disguise
trans: vt. 掩饰；假装；隐瞒 n. 伪装；假装；用作伪装的东西

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

name: media
trans: n. 媒体；媒质（medium的复数）；血管中层；浊塞音；中脉

sentences.english: The scandal was widely reported in the national media .
sentences.chinese: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。

sentences.english: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
sentences.chinese: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。

sentences.english: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。

sentences.english: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
sentences.chinese: 别的地方还会有战争，全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新闻媒介， 传播媒介
detailed_translations.english: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

name: prank
trans: n. 恶作剧，开玩笑；戏谑 vt. 装饰；打扮 vi. 炫耀自己；胡闹

sentences.english: a childish prank
sentences.chinese: 孩子气的恶作剧

detailed_translations.english: a trick, especially one which is played on someone to make them look silly
to dress or decorate showily or gaudily

name: traditional
trans: adj. 传统的；惯例的

sentences.english: traditional Italian cooking
sentences.chinese: 传统的意大利烹饪

trans: vt. 说服；使确信，使信服

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: election
trans: n. 选举；当选；选择权；上帝的选拔

sentences.english: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.english: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
sentences.chinese: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

detailed_translations.english: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

name: miserable
trans: adj. 悲惨的；痛苦的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送 vi. 代表；提出异议

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: sign
trans: n. 迹象；符号；记号；手势；指示牌 vi. 签署；签名 vt. 签署；示意

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

name: copper
trans: n. 铜；铜币；警察 adj. 铜制的 vt. 镀铜 n. (Copper)人名；(英)科珀

sentences.english: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

detailed_translations.english: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour

name: dynamite
trans: n. 炸药；具有潜在危险的人（或物） vt. 炸毁 adj. 极好的

sentences.english: a dynamite blast
sentences.chinese: 炸药爆炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 炸药；具有潜在危险的人（或物）
detailed_translations.english: a powerful explosive used especially for breaking rock
to damage or destroy something with dynamite

name: mine
trans: n. 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷 vt. 开采，采掘；在…布雷 vi. 开矿，采矿；埋设地雷 pron. 我的 n. (Mine)人名；(德、塞、土、毛里塔)米内

sentences.english: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

name: ore
trans: n. 矿；矿石 n. (Ore)人名；(意、瑞典)奥雷；(英)奥尔

sentences.english: iron ore
sentences.chinese: 铁矿石

sentences.english: veins of rich ore
sentences.chinese: 富矿脉

detailed_translations.english: rock or earth from which metal can be obtained

name: tour
trans: n. 旅游，旅行；巡回演出 vt. 旅行，在……旅游；在……作巡回演出 vi. 旅行，旅游；作巡回演出 n. (Tour)人名；(瑞典)托尔；(英)图尔

sentences.english: We met on a coach tour in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 我们是在意大利乘长途客车旅游时相识的。

detailed_translations.english: a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc

name: tunnel
trans: n. 隧道；坑道；洞穴通道 vt. 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道 vi. 挖掘隧道；打开通道

sentences.english: a railway tunnel
sentences.chinese: 铁路隧道

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )
sentences.chinese: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

detailed_translations.english: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
detailed_translations.english: to dig a long passage under the ground

name: confident
trans: adj. 自信的；确信的

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: definition
trans: n. 定义；[物] 清晰度；解说

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

name: embarrassed
trans: adj. 尴尬的；窘迫的 v. 使...困窘；使...局促不安（embarrass的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.english: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

name: vocabulary
trans: n. 词汇；词表；词汇量

sentences.english: Teachers were impressed by his vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 他的词汇量给老师们留下了深刻的印象。

detailed_translations.english: all the words that someone knows or uses

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的 vt. 使熄灭

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: meteorite
trans: n. 陨石，陨星；流星

sentences.english: I close the meteorite room and try the door across thecorridor.
sentences.chinese: 我关上陨石房间的门，又打开了走廊对面的门。

sentences.english: If the contamination were terrestrial, one could expect equal amounts of the molecules (or less) to be present in the meteorite samples, certainly not more.
sentences.chinese: 如果污染是来自地面的，在陨石样品中有可能会发现等量（或者较少）的分子，但肯定不会多。

sentences.english: The group, based at Imperial College London, found some of the base building blocks for life, nucleobases, in dust from the Murchison meteorite which fell to Earth in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 研究小组由伦敦帝国学院创建，他们在1969年坠入地球的默奇森陨石尘埃中发现了碱基，这是构建生命的基本成分。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of rock or metal from space that has landed on Earth

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: reptile
trans: n. 爬行动物；（非正式）卑鄙的人 adj. 爬行动物的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: trait
trans: n. 特性，特点；品质；少许 n. (Trait) （美、法）特雷（人名）

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: alert
trans: adj. 警惕的，警觉的；机警的，机敏的；充分意识到的 v. 使警觉，警告；使意识到 n. 警戒，警惕；警报；警戒期；（电子设备的）提示信号 n. (Alert)（美、德、俄、西、印）阿莱尔特（人名）

sentences.english: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
sentences.chinese: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

detailed_translations.english: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
to make someone realize something important or dangerous

detailed_translations.chinese: 警戒， 戒备； 警报
detailed_translations.english: a warning to be ready for possible danger

name: chemical
trans: n. 化学制品，化学药品 adj. 化学的

sentences.english: the chemical composition of bleach
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂的化学成分

sentences.english: a chemical analysis of the soil
sentences.chinese: 对土壤的化学分析

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances
relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances

name: comfort
trans: n. 安慰；舒适；安慰者 vt. 安慰；使（痛苦等）缓和

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

name: detection
trans: n. 侦查，探测；发觉，发现；察觉

sentences.english: ...the early detection of breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: …乳腺癌的早期发现。

detailed_translations.english: when something is found that is not easy to see, hear etc, or the process of looking for it

name: disability
trans: n. 残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件

sentences.english: Facilities for people with disabilities are still insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 供残疾人使用的设施仍然不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件
detailed_translations.english: A disability is a permanent injury, illness, or physical or mental condition that tends to restrict the way that someone can live their life

name: spasm
trans: n. [临床] 痉挛；抽搐；一阵发作

sentences.english: Maggie felt a muscle spasm in her back.
sentences.chinese: 玛吉觉得背部肌肉一阵抽搐。

sentences.english: Tom’s jaw muscles had gone into spasm .
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的颌部肌肉开始抽搐。

detailed_translations.chinese: [临床] 痉挛；抽搐；一阵发作
detailed_translations.english: an occasion when your muscles suddenly become tight, causing you pain

name: altar
trans: n. 祭坛；圣坛；圣餐台 n. (Altar)人名；(法、塞、罗)阿尔塔

sentences.english: a crucifix above the high altar
sentences.chinese: 主圣坛上方的耶稣受难像

sentences.english: The victim was tied to a sacrificial altar.
sentences.chinese: 牺牲被绑在祭坛上。

detailed_translations.english: a holy table or surface used in religious ceremonies

name: celebration
trans: n. 庆典，庆祝会；庆祝；颂扬

sentences.english: the lively New Year celebrations in the city centre
sentences.chinese: 市中心热闹的新年庆祝活动

detailed_translations.english: an occasion or party when you celebrate something

name: decoration
trans: n. 装饰，装潢；装饰品；奖章

sentences.english: Christmas decorations
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节装饰物

sentences.english: cake decorations
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕上的裱花

detailed_translations.english: something pretty that you put in a place or on top of something to make it look attractive

name: gravestone
trans: n. 墓碑，墓石

name: adjust
trans: vt. 调整，使…适合；校准 vi. 调整，校准；适应

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

name: confusion
trans: n. 混淆，混乱；困惑

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: float
trans: v. 使漂浮，浮动；漂流，飘动；飘移；安排（贷款）提出，提请考虑（想法或计划）；发行（股票）上市；（货币汇率）自由浮动实行 n. （酒吧等用于给顾客找零的）备用零钱；彩车，花车；浮板；漂浮物；鱼漂；浮子；加冰激凌的饮料；浮动期；坐浮箱（治病、疗伤或放松）；救生圈 n. (Float)（美、英、德）弗洛特（人名）

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

name: inspection
trans: n. 视察，检查

sentences.english: An inspection was carried out at the school.
sentences.chinese: 有人来学校视察了一遍。

sentences.english: However, on closer inspection, a number of problems emerged.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经进一步检查，很多问题冒了出来。

detailed_translations.english: an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

name: observe
trans: vt. 庆祝 vt. 观察；遵守；说；注意到；评论 vi. 观察；说；注意到；评论

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: blimp
trans: n. 顽固的保守分子；软式小型飞船；隔音罩

name: cargo
trans: n. 货物，船货 n. (Cargo)人名；(英、西)卡戈

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

name: propeller
trans: n. [航][船] 螺旋桨；推进器

sentences.english: ...a fixed three-bladed propeller.
sentences.chinese: …一个固定的三叶螺旋桨。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试 v. 尝试；试验；进行实验

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: model
trans: n. 模型；典型；模范；模特儿；样式 vt. 模拟；塑造；模仿 vi. 做模型；做模特儿 adj. 模范的；作模型用的 n. (Model)人名；(德、俄、英)莫德尔

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

name: solar system
trans: [天] 太阳系

sentences.english: Why do scientists think something could be hidden beyond the edge of our solar system?
sentences.chinese: 为什么科学家认为可能有某种东西潜藏在太阳系的边缘？

detailed_translations.english: the Sun and the  planets  that go around it

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜 v. 叠套缩短；精简，压缩；（车）相撞而嵌进

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: trial
trans: n. 试验；审讯；努力；磨炼 adj. 试验的；审讯的 n. (Trial)人名；(法)特里亚尔

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: bewildered
trans: adj. 困惑的；眩 v. 使困惑（bewilder的过去分词）

name: frenzied
trans: adj. 疯狂的；狂乱的；激怒的 v. 使狂乱（frenzy的过去式）

sentences.english: A woman was stabbed to death in a frenzied attack on her home tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚一名女子在家中遭遇疯狂袭击，被刺身亡。

sentences.english: frenzied efforts to find a solution
sentences.chinese: 寻求解决办法的疯狂努力

detailed_translations.english: frenzied activity is fast and uncontrolled, usually because it is done by someone feeling very anxious or excited

name: precious
trans: adj. 宝贵的；珍贵的；矫揉造作的 n. (Precious)人名；(英)普雷舍斯，普雷舍丝(女名)

sentences.english: planes delivering precious supplies of medicine and food
sentences.chinese: 运送药品、食品等宝贵物资的飞机

sentences.english: our planet’s precious resources
sentences.chinese: 我们星球上的宝贵资源

detailed_translations.english: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

name: tragic
trans: adj. 悲剧的；悲痛的，不幸的

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: wealthy
trans: adj. 富有的；充分的；丰裕的 n. 富人

sentences.english: the wealthy nations of the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上的富国

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of money, possessions etc

name: curious
trans: adj. 好奇的，有求知欲的；古怪的；爱挑剔的

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: gobble
trans: vi. 贪食；咯咯叫 vt. 狼吞虎咽 n. 火鸡叫声

sentences.english: The gobble sound, from the male turkeys, on the other hand, sounds exactly like you’d expect from the name and they do this all the time.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面来说，雄火鸡发出的咯咯声听上去绝对就是你从它们的名字就能预料到的那样，而火鸡一直如此。

detailed_translations.english: to make a sound like a  turkey
the loud rapid gurgling sound made by male turkeys

name: groan
trans: vi. 呻吟；抱怨；发吱嘎声 vt. 呻吟；抱怨 n. 呻吟；叹息；吱嘎声

sentences.english: The kids all groaned when I switched off the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我关掉电视时，孩子们都发出不满的抱怨声。

sentences.english: Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
sentences.chinese: 理查德的笑话让你哭笑不得。

detailed_translations.english: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable
a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something

name: porridge
trans: n. 粥，糊；麦片粥 vt. 服刑

sentences.english: I'll pass on the fried potato crisp, but take the porridge.
sentences.chinese: 炸土豆片我不吃了，粥还是要喝的。

detailed_translations.english: oats  that are cooked with milk or water and served hot for breakfast

name: resist
trans: vi. 抵抗，抗拒；忍耐 vt. 抵抗；忍耐，忍住 n. [助剂] 抗蚀剂；防染剂

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: routine
trans: n. 常规，惯例；生活乏味；（演出中的）一套动作；（计算机）例行程序 adj. 常规的，例行的；平常的；乏味的 v. 按惯例安排

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: axis
trans: n. 轴；轴线；轴心国

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
sentences.chinese: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。

detailed_translations.english: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

name: develop
trans: vt. 开发；进步；使成长；使显影 vi. 发育；生长；进化；显露

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: force
trans: n. 力量；武力；军队；魄力 vt. 促使，推动；强迫；强加 n. (Force)人名；(意)福尔切；(英、法)福斯

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: galaxy
trans: n. [天] 星系；银河系（the Galaxy）；一群显赫的人 n. 三星智能手机品牌 2015年三星中国公布Galaxy的中文名称为“盖乐世”（Galaxy） [ 复数galaxies ]

sentences.english: Astronomers have discovered a distant galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家们发现了一个遥远的星系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 银河；[天] 星系；银河系；一群显赫的人
detailed_translations.english: one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: patrol
trans: n. 巡逻；巡逻队；侦察队 vt. 巡逻；巡查 vi. 巡逻；巡查

sentences.english: The security forces increased their patrols in the area.
sentences.chinese: 安全部队加强了对该地区的巡逻。

detailed_translations.english: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

name: penguin
trans: n. 企鹅；空军地勤人员

sentences.english: He asked some birds if they knew where the penguin came from. But they ignored him.
sentences.chinese: 他去问小鸟们，知不知道小企鹅是从哪里来的啊，可是她们却睬都不睬他。

sentences.english: Perhaps we cannot relate to the severe conditions enduring by the Emperor penguin, but each of us knows what it means to sit on our own versions of ice and egg.
sentences.chinese: 可能我们无法理解国王企鹅所忍受的严酷环境与我们有何关联，但我们每一个人都知道在冰上孵育自己的蛋代表什么意思。

detailed_translations.english: a large black and white Antarctic sea bird, which cannot fly but uses its wings for swimming

name: population
trans: n. 人口；[生物] 种群，[生物] 群体；全体居民；[统计学] 总体

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵 adj. 志愿的 vi. 自愿 vt. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: Braille
trans: n. (Braille) 布莱叶盲文 v. (Braille) 用布莱叶点字法印刷 n. (Braille) （法）布莱叶（人名）

sentences.english: For 150 years, Braille books were designed to function as much as possible like print books.
sentences.chinese: 150年来，布莱叶盲文书籍设计的功能尽可能做到与印刷图书相同。

sentences.english: At the convention this statistic was frequently cited with pride, so much so that those who didn’t know Braille were sometimes made to feel like outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 在国家盲人联合会的年会上，这个研究数据经常被引用，以至于那些没学过布莱叶的人觉得自己像个局外人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 布莱叶（法国盲人教育家）；盲人用点字法
detailed_translations.english: Braille is a system of printing for blind people. The letters are printed as groups of raised dots that you can feel with your fingers.

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染 vt. 传达；感染；显露

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: inspiration
trans: n. 灵感；鼓舞；吸气；妙计

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: senses
trans: n. [生理] 感觉；意义；理智；判断力（sense的复数） v. 理解；感到；认识（sense的单三形式） n. (Senses)人名；(英)森西斯

name: survive
trans: vt. 幸存；生还；幸免于；比...活得长 vi. 幸存；活下来

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: discard
trans: vt. 抛弃；放弃；丢弃 vi. 放弃 n. 抛弃；被丢弃的东西或人

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: latex
trans: n. 乳胶；乳液

name: mesh
trans: n. 网眼；网丝；圈套；网格 vi. 相啮合 vt. [机] 啮合；以网捕捉

sentences.english: The ground-floor windows are obscured by wire mesh.
sentences.chinese: 底楼的窗户被铁丝网罩着。

detailed_translations.english: Mesh is material like a net made from wire, thread, or plastic
if two ideas or things mesh, they fit together very well

name: vat
trans: n. （尤指工业用的、装液体的）大桶，大缸，大罐；还原式染料 v. 放入大缸中（处理） n. (Vat) （乌克兰、美）瓦（人名）

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…盛入大桶；把…放入大桶里染

detailed_translations.english: a very large container for storing liquids in

name: wad
trans: n. 填料；块状软物 vt. 使成一团；填塞；使成卷 vi. 易形成团块 n. (Wad)人名；(德、瑞典)瓦德

name: carat
trans: n. 克拉（等于karat） n. (Carat)人名；(法)卡拉

sentences.english: the Orloff diamond, a stone of 194.5 carats
sentences.chinese: 奥尔洛夫钻石，一块194.5克拉的宝石

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the weight of jewels, equal to 200  milligram s

name: diamond
trans: n. 钻石，金刚石；菱形；方块牌 adj. 菱形的；金刚钻的 n. (Diamond)人名；(英、意、葡)戴蒙德；(法)迪亚蒙

sentences.english: a diamond engagement ring
sentences.chinese: 订婚钻戒

detailed_translations.chinese: 钻石，金刚石；菱形；方块牌
detailed_translations.english: a clear, very hard valuable stone, used in jewellery and in industry

name: facet
trans: n. 面；方面；小平面 vt. 在…上琢面

sentences.english: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题很复杂，涉及诸多方面。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

name: jewel
trans: n. 宝石；珠宝 vt. 镶以宝石；饰以珠宝

sentences.english: She loved dressing up and wearing priceless jewels.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢穿上盛装，戴上极为昂贵的珠宝首饰。

detailed_translations.english: a valuable stone, such as a diamond

name: mystery
trans: n. 秘密，谜；神秘，神秘的事物；推理小说，推理剧；常作 mysteries 秘技，秘诀

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: pendant
trans: n. 垂饰，坠饰；吊灯；短索；补充作品；三角旗 adj. 下垂的

sentences.english: a ruby pendant
sentences.chinese: 红宝石吊坠

detailed_translations.english: a jewel, stone etc that hangs from a thin chain that you wear around your neck

name: advantage
trans: n. 优势；利益；有利条件 vi. 获利 vt. 有利于；使处于优势

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

name: audience
trans: n. 观众；听众；读者；接见；正式会见；拜会

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: audition
trans: n. （对演艺人员的）面试，试演；听觉，听能 v. 试演，试唱；对（某人）进行面试，让（某人）试演（或试唱、试音）

sentences.english: ...an audition for a Broadway musical.
sentences.chinese: …一部百老汇歌舞剧的试演。

detailed_translations.english: An audition is a short performance given by an actor, dancer, or musician so that a director or conductor can decide if they are good enough to be in a play, film, or orchestra
to take part in an audition

name: limb
trans: n. 肢，臂；分支；枝干 vt. 切断…的手足；从…上截下树枝 n. (Limb)人名；(朝)林；(英)利姆

sentences.english: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
sentences.chinese: 她将可以伸开蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

sentences.english: She sat on a limb of the tree and looked down.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：她坐在一根大树枝上往下看.

detailed_translations.english: an arm or leg

name: rehearsal
trans: n. 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述

sentences.english: a wedding rehearsal
sentences.chinese: 婚礼的预演

detailed_translations.chinese: 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述
detailed_translations.english: a time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance

name: championship
trans: n. 锦标赛；冠军称号；冠军的地位

sentences.english: the women’s figure skating championships
sentences.chinese: 女子花样滑冰锦标赛

sentences.english: Greece won the European Championship.
sentences.chinese: 希腊队赢得了欧洲锦标赛的冠军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锦标赛；冠军称号；冠军的地位
detailed_translations.english: a competition to find which player, team etc is the best in a particular sport

name: Japan
trans: n. 漆器；日本亮漆 vt. 在…上涂漆

sentences.english: We set sail from China for Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我们从中国启航驶往日本。

name: record
trans: n. 记录，记载；唱片；（过去的）经历，履历；纪录，最佳成绩；前科，犯罪记录 v. 记录，记载；录制；发表正式声明；（仪器）标明，显示；取得（成就） adj. 创纪录的 n. (Record) （美）勒科尔（人名）

sentences.english: According to official records, five people were killed last year near that road junction.
sentences.chinese: 据官方记录，去年有五人在那个路口附近丧生。

sentences.english: His record reveals a tough streak.
sentences.chinese: 他的经历说明他个性坚强。

sentences.english: Her husband made her record every penny she spent.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫要她把花的每分钱都记下来。

detailed_translations.english: information about something that is written down or stored on computer, film etc so that it can be looked at in the future
to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future

name: rookie
trans: n. 新手 新人

sentences.english: rookie cops
sentences.chinese: 新手警察

sentences.chinese: 词源学：越过英格兰，从一个陆地到另一个陆地，爱尔兰。

sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰，葡萄牙和希腊都需要救助。

trans: n. 绿洲；舒适的地方；令人宽慰的事物 n. (Oasis)人名；(英)奥西斯

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

detailed_translations.english: a place with water and trees in a desert

name: reservation
trans: n. 预约，预订；保留

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: tribe
trans: n. 部落；族；宗族；一伙 n. (Tribe)人名；(英)特赖布

sentences.english: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

detailed_translations.english: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

name: atom
trans: n. 原子

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

name: electromagnet
trans: n. 电磁体，[电] 电磁铁；电磁石

sentences.english: Lifting electromagnet is a kind of lifting gear.
sentences.chinese: 起重电磁铁是起重工具的一种。

sentences.english: Is the key to control the hydraulic part, this system is through PLC control electromagnet of solenoid valve, to achieve control of the manipulator's action.
sentences.chinese: 液压部分是控制的关键所在，本系统是通过PLC控制电磁阀的电磁铁，从而实现对机械手各动作的控制。

sentences.english: Metallurgical hoist, electric hoist, chain hoist, chain hoists, trolleys, grab, electric flat car, lifting electromagnet, hand hoist, sling, Jack, hoist, bearing.
sentences.chinese: 电动葫芦，冶金葫芦，环链葫芦，手拉葫芦，单轨小车，抓斗，电动平车，起重电磁铁，手扳葫芦，吊索具，千斤顶，卷扬机，轴承。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal that becomes magnetic(= able to attract metal objects ) when an electric current is turned on

name: motor
trans: n. 发动机，马达；汽车 adj. 汽车的；机动的 vi. 乘汽车 vt. 以汽车载运

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

name: repel
trans: vt. 击退；抵制；使厌恶；使不愉快

sentences.english: The smell repelled him.
sentences.chinese: 这气味让他反感。

detailed_translations.english: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

name: blubber
trans: n. 鲸脂；哭泣 vi. 又哭又闹 vt. 又哭又闹 adj. 肿大的

detailed_translations.english: the fat of sea animals, especially  whale s

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往 vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: illegal
trans: adj. [法] 非法的；违法的；违反规则的 n. 非法移民，非法劳工

sentences.english: illegal drugs
sentences.chinese: 违禁药品

sentences.english: They were involved in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与了非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by the law

name: march
trans: vi. （坚定地向某地）前进；行军，进军；游行示威；进展，进行 vt. 使前进；使行军 n. 行进，前进；行军；游行示威；进行曲

sentences.english: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
sentences.chinese: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。

sentences.english: The police decided not to ban the march.
sentences.chinese: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

detailed_translations.english: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something

name: movement
trans: n. 运动；活动；运转；乐章

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

name: nonviolence
trans: n. 非暴力；非暴力事件

name: segregated
trans: adj. 被隔离的 v. 隔离（segregate的过去式）；分离

name: forgery
trans: n. 伪造；伪造罪；伪造物

sentences.english: The painting was a very clever forgery.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是件很巧妙的赝品。

detailed_translations.english: a document, painting, or piece of paper money that has been copied illegally

name: masterpiece
trans: n. 杰作；绝无仅有的人

sentences.english: Mary Shelley was just 18 when she wrote the horror masterpiece ‘Frankenstein’.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽•雪莱创作《科学怪人》这部恐怖小说名作的时候年仅18岁。

detailed_translations.english: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

name: motive
trans: n. 动机，目的；主题 adj. 发动的；成为动机的 vt. 使产生动机，激起

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: pose
trans: vt. 造成，形成；摆姿势；装模作样；提出…讨论 vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作 n. 姿势，姿态；装模作样

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: theory
trans: n. 理论；原理；学说；推测

sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

name: adventure
trans: n. 冒险；冒险精神；投机活动 vt. 冒险；大胆说出 vi. 冒险

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.english: an adventure story
sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

detailed_translations.english: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

name: course
trans: n. 科目；课程；过程；进程；道路；路线，航向；一道菜 vt. 追赶；跑过 vi. 指引航线；快跑

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.english: During the course of our conversation, it emerged that Bob had been in prison.
sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，干扰，妨碍；障碍物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: themed
trans: adj. 以……为主题的；特定历史时期的；围绕特定主题的 v. 以……为主题（theme 的过去式和过去分词）

name: zombie
trans: n. 麻木迟钝的人；僵尸；（黑客用的）肉机；还魂神力鸡尾酒；蛇神

name: bow
trans: n. 弓；蝴蝶结；琴弓；船头 v. 鞠躬，点头；低（头）；屈从；（使）弯曲；用琴弓拉奏（弦乐器） n. (Bow) （美、英、爱尔兰）鲍（人名）

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

name: brass
trans: n. 黄铜；黄铜制品；铜管乐器；厚脸皮 n. (Brass)人名；(英、法、德)布拉斯

sentences.english: an old brass bedstead
sentences.chinese: 老式黄铜床架

sentences.english: to clean/polish the brass
sentences.chinese: 擦净 / 擦亮黄铜器

detailed_translations.english: a very hard bright yellow metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  zinc

name: keyboard
trans: n. 键盘 vt. 键入；用键盘式排字机排字 vi. 用键盘进行操作；作键盘式排字机排字

sentences.english: a computer keyboard
sentences.chinese: 计算机键盘

detailed_translations.english: a board with buttons marked with letters or numbers that are pressed to put information into a computer or other machine

detailed_translations.chinese: 键入；用键盘式排字机排字
detailed_translations.english: to put information into a computer, using a keyboard

name: percussion
trans: n. [临床] 叩诊；振动；碰撞；敲打乐器；打击乐器组

sentences.english: Tonight we have Paul Duke on percussion (= playing a percussion instrument ) .
sentences.chinese: 今晚我们请到保罗·杜克先生负责打击乐。

sentences.english: a range of percussion instruments
sentences.chinese: 一组打击乐器

detailed_translations.english: musical instruments such as drums, bells etc which you play by hitting them

name: strings
trans: n. 弦乐器；附带条件（string的复数）；带状物；珠串 v. 用带系上；使伸展；用线串；使紧张（string的三单形式）

name: woodwinds
trans: n. 木管乐器（woodwind复数）

name: emergency
trans: n. 紧急情况；突发事件；非常时刻 adj. 紧急的；备用的

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

name: equipment

sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: firefighter
trans: n. 消防队员

sentences.english: When every molecule in your body tells you to run away from the burning building, as a firefighter you have to resist the urge, override it and plunge in.
sentences.chinese: 当你身体内每个细胞都告诉逃离失火的建筑物时，作为一名消防员，你必须克制这种冲动，超越它，投入火场进行战斗。

sentences.english: He mows lawns and gardens for half a dozen clients in Grafton, some of them family friends. And he is an active volunteer firefighter.
sentences.chinese: 他为格拉夫顿六户人家修剪草坪和花园，他们中一些是父母的朋友，此外他还是个积极的义务消防员。

sentences.english: Locally and from the state standpoint, we had some firefighter jobs that were in jeopardy, up in the hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 站在州政府的立场，我们有一些消防员在危险岗位工作，最多时有数百人。

name: rescue
trans: v. 营救，援救；（非正式）防止……丢失 n. 营救，解救，援救；营救行动

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: shift
trans: v. 转移；快速移动；变换；改变观点；推卸（责任）；振作；移位；狼吞虎咽地吃；去除（污迹）；销售，出售；换挡；轮班；含糊其辞，拐弯抹角 n. 转移；改变，转变；手段；轮班；轮班职工；转换（键）；（直筒式）连衣裙，内衣；计谋，诡计

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: creature
trans: n. 动物，生物；人；创造物

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: defeat
trans: v. 击败；挫败（某人）；阻止达成（目的）；反对（动议或提议）；（使）无法理解；（使）无效 n. 失败；战胜

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

name: enemy
trans: n. 敌人，仇敌；敌军 adj. 敌人的，敌方的

sentences.english: She’s a dangerous enemy to have.
sentences.chinese: 与她为敌很危险。

sentences.english: Cats and dogs have always been natural enemies.
sentences.chinese: 猫和狗向来是天敌。

sentences.english: an old enemy of her father
sentences.chinese: 她父亲的一个宿敌

sentences.english: the unforgettable sight of the president shaking hands with his sworn enemy
sentences.chinese: 董事长与其死敌握手的难忘情景

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wishthis on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 即使是我的死对头，我也不愿看到他发生这样的事情。

detailed_translations.english: someone who hates you and wants to harm you

name: event
trans: n. 事件，大事；项目；结果

sentences.english: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
sentences.chinese: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: self-control
trans: n. 克己，自我控制

name: automobile
trans: n. 汽车 vt. 驾驶汽车 [ 过去式 automobiled 过去分词 automobiled 现在分词 automobiling ]

sentences.english: the automobile industry
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业

detailed_translations.english: a car

name: distance
trans: n. 距离；远方；疏远；间隔 vt. 疏远；把…远远甩在后面

sentences.english: Measure the distance between the two points.
sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.english: The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.english: Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ) .
sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space between two places or things

name: engine
trans: n. 引擎，发动机；机车，火车头；工具

sentences.english: Is the engine running smoothly?
sentences.chinese: 发动机运转平稳吗？

sentences.english: We were stranded with engine trouble on a deserted highway.
sentences.chinese: 我们因发动机故障而被困在空无一人的公路上。

sentences.english: In 1941, the train would have been pulled by a steam engine.
sentences.chinese: 1941年，火车可能已由蒸汽机车来牵引了。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make it move

name: inventor
trans: n. 发明家；[专利] 发明人；创造者

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things

name: manufacture
trans: n. 制造；产品；制造业 vt. 制造；加工；捏造 vi. 制造

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: production
trans: n. 成果；产品；生产；作品

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

name: endangered
trans: adj. 濒临灭绝的；有生命危险的
