sentences.english: Teachers reassured anxious parents.
sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation

name: slump
trans: v. （价格、数量等）骤降；重重地坐下（或倒下）；惨败；（肩或脑袋）耷拉着 n. （价格、数量等的）猛然严重下降；经济不景气时期；低潮期

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

name: cure
trans: v. 缓解（人或动物）的疾病症状，治疗；治愈；解决（问题）；（用腌、晒、熏等方法）加工处理，保存（肉、鱼、烟草、兽皮）；被硫化，使硬化；凝固，养护 n. 药物；疗法，治疗；治愈；对策；（对橡胶、塑料或其他材料的）熟化；（基督教牧师的）牧师责任（或责任区）；教区 n. (Cure) （美、法）楚雷（人名）

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

name: diaphragm
trans: n. 隔膜；快门，[摄] 光圈；横隔膜；隔板

name: distract
trans: vt. 转移；分心

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

name: signal
trans: n. 信号；暗号；导火线 vt. 标志；用信号通知；表示 adj. 显著的；作为信号的 vi. 发信号 n. (Signal)人名；(瑞典)西格纳尔

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

name: molt
trans: vi. 脱毛；换毛 n. 换毛；脱皮；换毛期 vt. 脱毛；换毛 n. (Molt)人名；(德、捷)莫尔特

sentences.english: Like other penguins, it undergoes an annual molt, replacing all its feathers in a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 和其他企鹅一样，它也经历一年一次的脱毛，在几周时间里替换掉所有的羽毛。

sentences.english: He said emperor penguins can spend months at a time in the ocean, coming ashore only to molt or rest, but did not know what might have caused this particular one to become disoriented.
sentences.chinese: 他说帝企鹅可以一次性在海里带上数月，上岸只是为了脱毛换羽和休息。 但不知道是什么造成了这只特别的企鹅变得分不清楚方向。

name: pinniped
trans: adj. 鳍脚亚目动物的 n. 鳍脚亚目动物

sentences.english: The legs were strong and ended in long feet very much like those of a modern pinniped.
sentences.chinese: 它的后肢很强壮，底部有长足，非常像现在的鳍足类动物。

sentences.english: The Australian sea lion is one of the rarest and most endangered pinniped in the world."--David Doubilet
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚海狮是世界上最稀有也是濒临灭绝的棋类动物之一。

sentences.english: As the killer whales moved in, the plucky pinniped leapt on to the vast ribbed belly of a humpback, and nestled in the animal's armpit.
sentences.chinese: 这头杀人鲸游过来的时候，这只勇敢的鳍足类动物跳上了座头鲸庞大的肋腹部，躲在它的腋窝下。

detailed_translations.english: of, relating to, or belonging to the Pinnipedia, an order of aquatic placental mammals having a streamlined body and limbs specialized as flippers: includes seals, sea lions, and the walrus

name: bloom
trans: n. 花；青春；旺盛 vt. 使开花；使茂盛 vi. 开花；茂盛 n. (Bloom)人名；(瑞典、西)布洛姆；(英)布卢姆

sentences.english: These plants bloom in spring.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物在春天开花。

sentences.english: They bloom for a month and fade away in no time.
sentences.chinese: 它们开花为一个月的时间和逐渐消失很快。

sentences.english: We noticed that these women began to bloom into greater self-confidence and even to shed unhealthy relationships. At that point we knew we were onto something big.
sentences.chinese: 我们注意到，这些妇女开始开花到更大的自信，甚至摆脱不健康的关系。在这一点上，我们知道我们正在做一件大事。

detailed_translations.english: if a plant or a flower blooms, its flowers appear or open

detailed_translations.chinese: 花，开花，开花期；青春焕发
detailed_translations.english: a flower or flowers

name: fertilizer
trans: n. [肥料] 肥料；受精媒介物；促进发展者

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现 vi. 复制；繁殖

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: sower
trans: n. 播种者；播种机；煽动者 n. (Sower)人名；(德)佐沃

name: thrive
trans: vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: breeder
trans: n. 饲养员；繁殖者；起因；增殖反应堆

name: counselor
trans: n. 顾问；法律顾问；参事（等于counsellor）

sentences.english: The counselor bounced up to denounce discount.
sentences.chinese: 顾问上升蹦跳指责折扣。

sentences.english: The next day as I was talking to my financial counselor he gave me advice on how I might avoid running out of money.
sentences.chinese: 隔天，当我跟我的理财顾问谈话时，他也提出建议，告诉我如何避免金钱耗尽。

sentences.english: What about using that background and talent in a different field, say as an admissions counselor for a nearby college or university?
sentences.chinese: 将你的资历和才能用在别的行业会怎么样呢？ 比如说去当附近一所大学或学院的招生顾问。

name: microchip
trans: n. 微型集成电路片，微芯片

sentences.english: Japan’s largest producer of microchips
sentences.chinese: 日本最大的芯片生产商

sentences.english: the microchip industry
sentences.chinese: 芯片产业

detailed_translations.chinese: 微型集成电路片，微芯片
detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of  silicon  containing a set of electronic parts, which is used in computers and other machines

name: purebred
trans: adj. （动物）纯种的 n. 纯种的动物

name: shelter
trans: n. 庇护；避难所；遮盖物 vt. 保护；使掩蔽 vi. 躲避，避难 n. (Shelter)人名；(英)谢尔特

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: veterinarian
trans: n. [兽医] 兽医

sentences.english: Include your ferret's medical records and veterinarian information in the package.
sentences.chinese: 救济包里面记得包含貂儿的医疗记录和兽医的信息。

sentences.english: This is not normally an issue that needs professional treatment by a veterinarian.
sentences.chinese: 小小的崩坏通常不需要兽医来为貂儿提供专业的诊疗。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained to give medical care and treatment to sick animals

name: adviser
trans: n. 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）

sentences.english: a financial adviser
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

detailed_translations.chinese: 顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice because they know a lot about a subject, especially in business, law, or politics

name: case
trans: n. 情况；实例；箱 vt. 包围；把…装于容器中 n. (Case)人名；(英)凯斯；(西)卡塞；(法)卡斯

sentences.english: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.english: a severe case of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒重病例

sentences.english: It is simply not the case that prison conditions are improving.
sentences.chinese: 监狱条件得到改善的情况绝非事实。

detailed_translations.english: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

name: confirm
trans: vt. 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: lawyer
trans: n. 律师；法学家 n. (Lawyer)人名；(英)劳耶

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: majority
trans: n. 多数；成年

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: collection
trans: n. 采集，聚集；[税收] 征收；收藏品；募捐

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: disaster
trans: n. 灾难，灾祸；不幸

sentences.english: One hundred and twenty people died in China’s worst air disaster .
sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.english: the economic consequences of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster
sentences.chinese: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

sentences.english: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.english: Their expedition nearly ended in disaster , when one of the climbers slid off the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍 vi. 忍耐；持续

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: impressive
trans: adj. 感人的；令人钦佩的；给人以深刻印象的

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: siege
trans: n. 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力 vt. 围攻；包围

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

name: boiler
trans: n. 锅炉；烧水壶，热水器；盛热水器

detailed_translations.english: a container for boiling water that is part of a steam engine, or is used to provide heating in a house

name: expand
trans: vt. 扩张；使膨胀；详述 vi. 发展；张开，展开

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: invention
trans: n. 发明；发明物；虚构；发明才能

sentences.english: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话
detailed_translations.english: the act of inventing something

name: locomotive
trans: n. 机车；火车头；（学校啦啦队）节奏由慢到快的欢呼 adj. 产生动力的，与动力有关的；运动的，移动的

sentences.english: How many coaches can that locomotive pull?
sentences.chinese: 那个机车能拉多少节客车?。

sentences.english: A chamber, such as the furnace of a steam locomotive, in which fuel is burned.
sentences.chinese: 火箱，燃烧室一种燃料在里面燃烧的内室，例如蒸汽机车的燃烧室。

sentences.english: Displaying some of his versatility, here Iqbal shows an HO electric locomotive, track and signals he made.
sentences.chinese: 展示了他的一些多才多艺，在这里伊克巴尔显示，一何电力机车，轨道和信号，他所作的。

detailed_translations.english: a railway engine

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力；压迫，[物] 压强 vt. 迫使；密封；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: steam engine
trans: 蒸汽机

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机 vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理 vi. 设计；建造

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: freedom
trans: n. 自由，自主；直率 n. (Freedom)人名；(英)弗里德姆

sentences.english: People here like their freedom and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。

sentences.english: the rights and freedoms of citizens
sentences.chinese: 公民的权利与自由

sentences.english: the freedom to vote
sentences.chinese: 选举自由

sentences.english: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
sentences.chinese: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

detailed_translations.english: the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: liberty
trans: n. 自由；许可；冒失 n. (Liberty)人名；(英)利伯蒂

sentences.english: the fight for liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 争取自由和平等的斗争

detailed_translations.english: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品 vt. 为…树碑

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: diabetes
trans: n. 糖尿病；多尿症

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

name: fructose
trans: n. [有化] 果糖；左旋糖

name: fuel
trans: n. 燃料；刺激因素；（为身体提供能量的）食物 vt. 给……提供燃料；刺激，煽动；推动 vi. 得到燃料 n. (Fuel) （美）傅爱乐（人名）

sentences.english: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
sentences.chinese: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

name: glucose
trans: n. 葡萄糖；葡糖（等于dextrose）

sentences.english: Now, if the insulin "key" cannot open up the cell to glucose, there is something interfering with it.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如果胰岛素这把“钥匙”无法打开细胞让葡萄糖进入，一定是有东西干扰。

sentences.english: Identifying the presence of brown fat is one thing, but activating it to burn more glucose is another.
sentences.chinese: 确定棕色脂肪的存在是一回事，但激活它让它燃烧更多葡萄糖是另一回事。

sentences.english: But refined carbohydrates, such as white bread and white rice, can be very quickly broken down to glucose, the primary fuel for the body.
sentences.chinese: 但是精制的碳水化合物，例如白面包或白米，可以十分迅速地分解为葡萄糖，提供身体最根本的燃料；

detailed_translations.english: a natural form of sugar that exists in fruit

name: lactose
trans: n. [有化] 乳糖

sentences.english: Somewhat less than 40% of people in the world retain the ability to digest lactose after childhood.
sentences.chinese: 全世界大约不到40%的成年人能够在童年过后保留消化乳糖的能力。

sentences.english: Some people have trouble digesting lactose, a carbohydrate in milk and milk products, because of the deficiency of enzyme lactase in the body.
sentences.chinese: 有些人无法消化乳糖，一种在牛奶和奶制品中的碳水化合物，这是因为在他们的身体中缺少乳糖消化酶。

sentences.english: Though children were able to drink milk, they typically developed lactose intolerance as they grew up.
sentences.chinese: 虽然小孩喝牛奶没有问题，但在长大后他们通常都会产生乳糖不耐受。

detailed_translations.english: a type of sugar found in milk, sometimes used as a food for babies and sick people

name: sucrose
trans: n. [食品][有化] 蔗糖

name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；大气；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: funnel
trans: n. 漏斗；漏斗状物；烟囱 v. （使）流经狭窄空间；通过漏斗将……导入；（使）通过漏斗般输送；形成漏斗状；（使）汇集，传送

sentences.english: ...a ship with three masts and two funnels.
sentences.chinese: …一艘有3根桅杆和2个烟囱的轮船。

detailed_translations.english: a thin tube with a wide top that you use for pouring liquid into a container with a narrow opening, such as a bottle

detailed_translations.chinese: 通过漏斗或烟囱等；使成漏斗形

name: rotate
trans: vi. 旋转；循环 vt. 使旋转；使转动；使轮流 adj. [植] 辐状的

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 地球每24小时绕地轴自转一周。

sentences.english: Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤到一半时把盘子转一下。

detailed_translations.english: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

name: struck
trans: v. 罢工；打击，撞击（strike 的过去式和过去分词） adj. 受罢工影响的 n. (Struck) （美、德、丹）斯特鲁克（人名）

name: tornado
trans: n. [气象] 龙卷风；旋风；暴风；大雷雨 n. (Tornado)人名；(西)托纳多

sentences.english: The tornado rubbished the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

name: cable car
trans: （美）缆车

sentences.english: "No cable car, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “没有缆车的。” 他说。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that hangs from a moving cable, and is used to take people up and down mountains

name: ceremony
trans: n. 典礼，仪式；礼节，礼仪；客套，虚礼

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: nervous
trans: adj. 神经的；紧张不安的；强健有力的

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: Olympics
trans: n. 奥林匹克运动会 奥林匹克运动会的

name: Portuguese
trans: adj. 葡萄牙的；葡萄牙人的；葡萄牙语的 n. 葡萄牙人；葡萄牙语

name: stadium
trans: n. 体育场；露天大型运动场

sentences.english: the new Olympic Stadium
sentences.chinese: 新的奥林匹克体育场

detailed_translations.chinese: 体育场；露天大型运动场
detailed_translations.english: a building for public events, especially sports and large rock music concerts, consisting of a playing field surrounded by rows of seats

name: explore
trans: vt. 探索；探测；探险 vi. 探索；探测；探险

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；工具；乐器；手段；器械 v. 给……装测量仪器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道 vt. 派遣；向……传教

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: probe
trans: n. 探针；调查 vi. 调查；探测 vt. 探查；用探针探测 n. (Probe)人名；(法)普罗布

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: function
trans: n. 功能；[数] 函数；职责；盛大的集会 vi. 运行；活动；行使职责

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: restore
trans: vt. 恢复；修复；归还 vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: schedule
trans: n. 计划（表）；时间表；一览表；（电视或广播）节目表；课程表；报税单；附件（尤指表格、单据等） v. 安排，预定；将……列入计划表或清单；把（建筑物）列为文物保护单位

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: substance
trans: n. 物质；实质；资产；主旨

sentences.english: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
sentences.chinese: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

sentences.english: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
sentences.chinese: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas

name: interpret
trans: vt. 说明；口译 vi. 解释；翻译

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员 n. (Justice)人名；(英)贾斯蒂斯，贾斯蒂丝(女名)

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: nominate
trans: vt. 推荐；提名；任命；指定

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: goalkeeper
trans: n. 守门员

sentences.english: ...the league's two best goalkeepers.
sentences.chinese: ...这届联赛的两名最佳守门员。

detailed_translations.english: the player in a sports team whose job is to try to stop the ball going into the goal

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字 n. (Legend)人名；(西)莱亨德；(英)莱金德

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: shootout
trans: n. 枪战；射门；起弧

name: tournament
trans: n. 锦标赛，联赛；比赛

sentences.english: She is aching to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.english: They dropped two games in a row and were eliminated from the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.english: It's no use egging him on; he's made up his mind not to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: uniform
trans: adj. 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的 n. 制服 vt. 使穿制服；使成一样

sentences.english: Grade A eggs must be of uniform size.
sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的
detailed_translations.english: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

name: upset
trans: vt. 使心烦；颠覆；扰乱 vi. 翻倒 adj. 心烦的；混乱的；弄翻的 n. 混乱；翻倒；颠覆

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick
